entry.title: Akshaya­puree­swarar Temple (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the Hindu god Shani is worshipped for protection from fear, accident, death and enemies in the 13th-century Akshaya­puree­swarar Temple (pictured)?

entry.title: Independence Lost (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Independence Lost argues that most support for the American Revolution was non-ideological?

entry.title: Jet Lady (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the first woman cleared to fly Boeing 747s recorded the 1982 outsider music album Jet Lady?

entry.title: myalgic encephalomyelitis/chronic fatigue syndrome (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that some people with severe myalgic encephalomyelitis/chronic fatigue syndrome can lose the ability to speak?

entry.title: Premier Maurice Duplessis (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Premier Maurice Duplessis, angry at the fact that the federal government of Canada was taking taxes at the expense of the provinces, once demanded that Ottawa "return our loot"?

entry.title: the 1993 event (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that with a population of 1,500, Millstreet in County Cork, Ireland, became the smallest settlement to host the Eurovision Song Contest when it staged the 1993 event?

entry.title: Herodian Quarter (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the mansions in the Herodian Quarter contain frescoes with burn marks and charred wooden beams, serving as evidence of Jerusalem's destruction in 70 AD?

entry.title: Get Lost (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that as of December 2023, Get Lost claimed to have helped nearly 20,000 people avoid conscription in Russia?

entry.title: Şimal Yılmaz (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Turkish sport shooter Şimal Yılmaz, who qualified for the 2024 Summer Olympics, had a shooting range in her living room?
